channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Seahawks win Super Bowl title, pounding the Patriots 29-13
item.description: Seattle's "Dark Side" defense helped Sam Darnold become the first quarterback in the 2018 draft class to win a Super Bowl, to win the franchise's second title.
item.content:encoded:
Seattle's "Dark Side" defense helped Sam Darnold become the first quarterback in the 2018 draft class to win a Super Bowl, to win the franchise's second title.

(Image credit: Mark J. Terrill)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: No, that wasn't Liam Conejo Ramos in Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show
item.description: A publicist for Bad Bunny confirmed to NPR that the little boy in a blue bunny hat detained by ICE in Minneapolis last month did not participate in the Super Bowl halftime show.
item.content:encoded:
A publicist for Bad Bunny confirmed to NPR that the little boy in a blue bunny hat detained by ICE in Minneapolis last month did not participate in the Super Bowl halftime show.

(Image credit: Julio Cortez)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Seahawks ride their 'Dark Side' defense to a Super Bowl title, pounding the Patriots 29-13
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks have won the franchise's second Super Bowl, and defense was the driving force behind this championship.
item.content:encoded:
The Seattle Seahawks have won the franchise's second Super Bowl, and defense was the driving force behind this championship.

(Image credit: Sue Ogrocki)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Here's what happened at Kid Rock's alternative halftime show
item.description: Kid Rock headlined conservative group Turning Point USA's alternative halftime event.
item.content:encoded:
Kid Rock headlined conservative group Turning Point USA's alternative halftime event.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: March for Life attendees may have been exposed to measles, DC Health warns
item.description: D.C. health officials are contacting people possibly exposed to measles at the March for Life in January, as confirmed cases rise nationwide.
item.content:encoded:
D.C. health officials are contacting people possibly exposed to measles at the March for Life in January, as confirmed cases rise nationwide.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Breezy Johnson wins gold, while Lindsey Vonn crash ends comeback quest
item.description: On the first Sunday of the Olympic Winter Games, downhill skier Breezy Johnson captured the first gold for Team USA. And alpine racer Lindsay Vonn crashed and was transported to the hospital with a broken leg.
item.content:encoded: On the first Sunday of the Olympic Winter Games, downhill skier Breezy Johnson captured the first gold for Team USA. And alpine racer Lindsay Vonn crashed and was transported to the hospital with a broken leg.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: Investigating one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history
item.description: More than a week after one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history, many questions remain unanswered, and survivors struggle to move on.
item.content:encoded: More than a week after one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history, many questions remain unanswered, and survivors struggle to move on.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: U.S. gave Ukraine and Russia June deadline to reach peace agreement, Zelenskyy says
item.description: "The Americans are proposing the parties end the war by the beginning of this summer," Zelenskyy said, speaking to reporters on Friday.
item.content:encoded:
"The Americans are proposing the parties end the war by the beginning of this summer," Zelenskyy said, speaking to reporters on Friday.

(Image credit: Sergei Grits)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.K. leader's chief of staff quits over hiring of Epstein friend as U.S. ambassador
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer's chief of staff resigned Sunday over the furor surrounding the appointment of Peter Mandelson as U.K. ambassador to the U.S. despite his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
British Prime Minister Keir Starmer's chief of staff resigned Sunday over the furor surrounding the appointment of Peter Mandelson as U.K. ambassador to the U.S. despite his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump administration lauds plastic surgeons' statement on trans surgery for minors
item.description: A patient who came to regret the top surgery she got as a teen won a $2 million malpractice suit. Then, the American Society of Plastic Surgeons clarified its position that surgery is not recommended for transgender minors.
item.content:encoded:
A patient who came to regret the top surgery she got as a teen won a $2 million malpractice suit. Then, the American Society of Plastic Surgeons clarified its position that surgery is not recommended for transgender minors.

(Image credit: Mariam Zuhaib)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin
